body:
Facebook Inc. (NASDAQ:FB)‘s stock had its “buy” rating reaffirmed by equities researchers at Jefferies Group in a report released on Tuesday. They presently have a $175.00 price target on the social networking company’s stock, up from their prior price target of $170.00. Jefferies Group’s price objective suggests a potential upside of 35.27% from the company’s current price.

A number of other analysts have also recently commented on the company. Vetr raised Facebook from a “buy” rating to a “strong-buy” rating and set a $129.91 price target for the company in a research report on Monday, January 2nd. Axiom Securities boosted their price objective on Facebook from $155.00 to $160.00 and gave the company a “buy” rating in a report on Thursday, November 3rd. Goldman Sachs Group Inc. reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $162.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Thursday, December 29th. Citigroup Inc. reissued a “buy” rating and issued a $158.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Wednesday, October 12th. Finally, Macquarie reissued an “outperform” rating and issued a $155.00 price objective on shares of Facebook in a report on Monday, October 10th. One investment analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, six have given a hold rating, forty-four have assigned a buy rating and three have given a strong buy rating to the stock. The company has a consensus rating of “Buy” and a consensus price target of $150.27.

Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) traded up 0.34% during mid-day trading on Tuesday, hitting $129.37. The company had a trading volume of 15,162,724 shares. The firm has a market capitalization of $372.87 billion, a P/E ratio of 49.87 and a beta of 0.66. Facebook has a 12 month low of $94.23 and a 12 month high of $133.50. The company has a 50-day moving average price of $121.50 and a 200 day moving average price of $123.96.

Facebook (NASDAQ:FB) last issued its quarterly earnings results on Wednesday, November 2nd. The social networking company reported $1.09 EPS for the quarter, topping the Zacks’ consensus estimate of $0.97 by $0.12. Facebook had a return on equity of 16.51% and a net margin of 30.32%. The company earned $7 billion during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $6.90 billion. During the same quarter in the previous year, the firm posted $0.57 EPS. The firm’s revenue was up 55.8% compared to the same quarter last year. Equities analysts forecast that Facebook will post $4.10 EPS for the current fiscal year.

In other Facebook news, VP Colin Stretch sold 750 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction dated Tuesday, November 1st. The shares were sold at an average price of $130.45, for a total value of $97,837.50. Following the completion of the transaction, the vice president now owns 81,940 shares in the company, valued at approximately $10,689,073. The transaction was disclosed in a legal filing with the SEC, which is available through the SEC website. Also, CEO Mark Zuckerberg sold 809,977 shares of the company’s stock in a transaction dated Friday, November 18th. The stock was sold at an average price of $117.29, for a total transaction of $95,002,202.33. The disclosure for this sale can be found here. In the last ninety days, insiders have sold 5,174,864 shares of company stock valued at $618,444,054. Insiders own 19.08% of the company’s stock.

A number of hedge funds and other institutional investors have recently bought and sold shares of the company. Farmers & Merchants Investments Inc. raised its stake in shares of Facebook by 11.9% in the third quarter. Farmers & Merchants Investments Inc. now owns 901 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $116,000 after buying an additional 96 shares in the last quarter. Jacobus Wealth Management Inc. bought a new stake in shares of Facebook during the third quarter worth $121,000. Orinda Asset Management LLC bought a new stake in shares of Facebook during the third quarter worth $126,000. Bartlett & Co. LLC raised its stake in shares of Facebook by 8.9% in the second quarter. Bartlett & Co. LLC now owns 1,116 shares of the social networking company’s stock worth $128,000 after buying an additional 91 shares in the last quarter. Finally, Integrated Wealth Counsel LLC bought a new stake in shares of Facebook during the third quarter worth $128,000. Hedge funds and other institutional investors own 56.16% of the company’s stock.

Facebook, Inc builds products that enable people to connect and share through mobile devices and personal computers. The Company enables people to share their opinions, ideas, photos and videos, and other activities. Its products include Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp and Oculus. Facebook is a mobile application and Website that enables people to connect, share, discover and communicate with each other on mobile devices and personal computers.
title: The Jefferies Group Reaffirms “Buy” Rating for Facebook Inc. (FB)
